topic.title: About the DITA Open Toolkit for Linux

titlealts.searchtitle: About DITA Open Toolkit for Linux

topic.shortdesc: The DITA Open Toolkit is an implementation of the OASIS DITA Technical Committee's specification for Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA) DTDs and schemas. The Toolkit transforms DITA XML source content into deliverable formats such as PDF, HTML, and help systems.

body.p: This guide explains how to install the DITA Open Toolkit and provides background and reference information to help you understand the process.

section.title: Installation Requirements
section.p: To successfully install the DITA Open Toolkit, you must have a Linux operating system running on your workstation.
